intro: Melandrium affine subsp. angustiflorum, commonly known as narrow-flowered catchfly, is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and the plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils. It is native to parts of Europe and western Asia, and it is often found in meadows and along roadsides. This subspecies is noted for its delicate appearance and its role in supporting pollinators.
